channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia detained by ICE in Baltimore
item.description: The lawyer for a man wrongly deported by the Trump administration to an El Salvador prison, then returned months later, says his client faces deportation again — this time to Uganda.

item.title: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson discusses Trump's threat to deploy National Guard
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep asks Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson about President Trump's threat to deploy the National Guard to his city.

item.title: President Trump threatens to deploy National Guard troops to Chicago
item.description: National Guard troops and federal agents have a visible presence in Washington, D.C., and now President Trump has threatened to send them into Chicago.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump threatens to deploy National Guard troops to Chicago, the latest on recent Department of Justice actions, South Korea's president to meet with Trump in D.C. on Monday.

item.title: Israeli military launches strikes as part of major offensive to capture Gaza City
item.description: Israeli aircraft and tanks are pounding the region around Gaza, killing dozens of Palestinians over the weekend, as part of a new, major offensive to capture Gaza City.

item.title: U.S. sending warships to Venezuelan waters
item.description: U.S. warships are heading to the waters off Venezuela in a significant show of force by the Trump administration. Officials say the ship are part of the president's effort to combat drug trafficking.

item.title: Atlantic staff writer Michael Scherer on Laura Loomer's influence on President Trump
item.description: NPR's A Martinez talks with Atlantic staff writer Michael Scherer about Laura Loomer's influence with President Trump and his administration.

item.title: People pay respects to Rudolph Valentino on 99th anniversary of his death
item.description: Fans of silent film star Rudolph Valentino gathered at a Hollywood cemetery over the weekend to mark 99 years since his death.

item.title: More on the DOJ's release of transcripts from its interview with Ghislaine Maxwell
item.description: The Trump DOJ is front and center as the reverberations of its actions last week are still being felt. On Friday, the DOJ released transcripts from its interview with Ghislaine Maxwell.

item.title: Former White House attorney Ty Cobb discusses the DOJ in Trump's second term
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Ty Cobb, a former Trump White House lawyer turned critic of the president, about Trump administration efforts to investigate and prosecute perceived wrongs.
